Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2015 12:12AM - edited Feb 11, 2015 12:14AM by courtnjury Count me in... I have been lurking for awhile. Was diagnosed November 3 2013as stage 4 with bone mets. Had chemo and rads and lumpectomy last year, was doing good on Arimidex then it stopped working. So this year started off with rads to the spine and starting chemo again on Friday, then I will be starting another inhibitor. Hoping this year we find the right combo:-)

Posts.Title: How long have you been Stage IV? goldie0827 dormouse

Posts.Content: Nov 24, 2014 08:19PM courtnjury wrote: I had Kyphoplasty surgery twice. Once for T7 &8 and another time for L5. Surgery was easy, I don't remember either surgeries I think they called it twilight. Was out if hospital about a hour or so after surgery. My T7 was pretty bad so didn't get much relief in that area but my L5 area there was a lot of relief pretty much right away. I only had a couple small incisions my husband says they looked like a plus sign about a half inch each. I guess it takes a couple weeks for those areas to heal. Hope I never need it again but would do it again if needed
